page.title: 08OLD RAILWAY NEAR ANDOVER
page.content: Running south from the present main London railway line at the spot where the Bourne Rivulet passes beneath it, one can still make out most of the route of the now dismantled {Hurstbourne to Fullerton railway. Opened on the 1st June 1885, and the track finally lifted in October 1934, all that remains for most of its length is a wide overgrown ditch, sometimes shallow, but nearer to {Hurstbourne Priors,}developing into a two-mile chalk cutting, in places up to fifty feet deep. This part is full of atmosphere, often gloomy and damp, roofed over by the trees high above and eerily quiet. However, the silence is temporary, for much of this dramatic cutting is used by the local{Game Shooting School.
